text: 4 oz pour on draft at Sweetwater Merrifield. Clear pale yellow with off-white head. Aromas of malt, corn. Tastes of malt, corn, wheat, light citrus. Light body with a dry finish.
Tap, gold pour, with white head, nose is caramel, taste is citrus, sweet beer overall

On tap half pint at Sweetwater Tavern in Centreville, VA. 

Clear, bright gold with an off-white head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of sweet malt and sweet floral aromas. 

Taste of malt, butter, caramel and light floral hops. 

Medium body and medium/low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Pouras a transparent light copper with a nice white head. 

S: light grain and hiumns of fruity sweetness, byut nothing overpowering. 

T: light malt touch with a light fruity crispness. Nothing too out of the ordinary, but a nice harmony in all the favors. 

M: medium-bodied and creamy. Amazing how theres no alcohol feel with this abv. 

D: nice and thirst-quenching. Becoming a big fan of thios brewpub.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 05-02-2010
Draft sample at Merrifield location.  Pours clear yellow with very small, rimming white head.  Malty nose.  Taste is alcoholic hot whit malt flavor.  Mild hop character and bitter.  Just ok.

Pint off taps at Brewery 05/10/2008.
Slightly hazy golden with moderate persistent head well carbonated.
Fruity bock yeast and sweet caramel malt aromas. Malty munich and vienna style malt sweetness with fruity bavarian yeast notes and spicey hops.
Full sweet mouthfeel with quite some bitterness in the finish.
On tap at the brewpub. Clear golden body with a medium frothy white head. Sweet malty Vienna aroma. Very sweet Vienna and honey flavor. Medium full body with moderately high carbonation.

Enjoyed a pint of this one on draught, at the Centreville, VA location. Pours to slightly hazy, deep golden color, with a thick, creamy, white head, and a good carbonation. The nose is excellent, with good pale and grainy malt aromas, paired with light hints of peppery alcohol. The palate is firm, with lots of good, crisp, pale and grainy malt flavor, on a smooth, clean, body. This beer finishes with more good, crisp, pale malt flavor up front, then ends with some good herbal hop bittereness, that balances and drys the beer out. Well done domestic example of maibock. At 7.7% abv it is a the kind of beer that could sneak up on you in hurry. Works well with a number of dishes on Sweetwaters menu, and a nice beer to sip and relax with a the bar.

Draft at Merrifield location.  Fantastic brew, light, golden clear color, with a thick white head.  Malty aroma, with some fruits.  Flavor is pretty light, and the that of caramel and honey.  For being over 7.5 the alcohol is masked quite well.

Draft... Sterling, VA location... Crystal clear, deep golden lager with a mid-sized, fluffy, white head. Great retention. Malty, fruity nose. Flavor-wise, good balance for the style... however, honey-sweet and only mildly bitter (its still a bock). Medium to full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Finishes a bit thin, but a joy overall.

(Merrifield) Clear golden body with white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, some caramel, light herb, honey.  Taste is moderately sweet, honey, caramel, some earthy, light alcohol.  Medium-full body, some stickiness.

Clear amber orange with a medium off-white head. Fruity aroma with pilsneresque hops. Taste has notes of caramel, fruitiness, toasted malts and plenty of hops. Pretty sweet with a somewhat bitter hop finish. Alcohol presence evident but not overpowering. Medium body with a very smooth texture and subtle carbonation. Plenty of lacing, great head retention. Good stuff.

Golden-amber body topped by a frothy white head with very nice glass lace. The aroma is light sweet malt grassy noble hopsm and light alcohol. The flavor is pretty nice sweet maltsw up front then a hefty dose of grassy and floral hops develop, all the while the alcohol stays back but is never totally absent. Medium bodied, very soft. Really quite nice IMO.
a greating drinking beer, amber in color with a decent aroma.  A good malt content.  Ill be going back for more

Bright gold.  Nose vaguely sweet, definite honey tones, bit of toastiness to the malt.  Quite sweet, honey continues in the flavor, bit of fruitiness as well.  Decently balanced with toasty and bready malts, finishes crisp with a bit of hops.  Palate is a bit thick and syrupy, reminds me of some of the "imperial pilsners" Ive had recently (which arent pilsners, but this was kind of like that).
